home_menu_general-passport_desc: The Timor-Leste Electronic Passport (TLEP) is an individual travel document, which allows its holders to enter and exit Timorese territory

home_menu_family-card_desc: A family registration form that collects information such as the name of the person responsible and the number of people in the house and the age range of family members.
home_menu_citizen-id_desc: The Citizen Card is a document that proves the Timorese nationality and civil identity of its holder, before any authorities and entities
home_menu_birth-certificate_desc: The Birth Certificate can be defined as the citizen's first and most important document, as it represents your official existence before the State
home_menu_marriage-certificate_desc: The Marriage Certificate is a document that proves the facts contained in the marriage register, before any authorities and entities

desc_service_new_birth_cert:
The Birth Certificate can be defined as the citizen's first and most important document, as it represents their official existence before the State and society. Possession of the Birth Certificate is essential for issuing other civil documents, as well as for accessing social benefits.

According to the Convention on the Rights of the Child, to which Timor-Leste is a signatory, “the child is registered immediately after birth and has from birth the right to a name, the right to acquire a nationality and, whenever possible, the right to know your parents and to be educated by them”.

Who can request the service: The father or mother of a newborn or child born in national territory or even born in foreign territory, whether the child of a Timorese father or mother.

Responsible Institution: Registration and Notary Department of the Ministry of Justice.

Service provision channels:

National Territory: Service is provided in person at the units of the Registration and Notary Department of the Ministry of Justice, in Dili and in the Municipalities.

Opening Hours:

Price for accessing the service: The issuance of the RDTL Birth Certificate is free.

Procedure required to access the service:

The citizen must prepared all the nescessary legal documents in soft copy and shall submit the request online.

Documentation for registration of children of baptized parents in the Catholic Church

Important: All scanned documents must be based on their original version, officer will verify the originality in the system.

  • A scanned of the Baptism Certificate of the father and mother;
  • A scanned of LISIO from the Hospital where the child was born;
  • scanned of the father and mother’s RDTL Birth Certificate;
  • A scanned of the father and mother’s Identity Card;
  • A scanned of the Marriage Certificate, for the purpose of proving marital status;
  • A scanned of the father and mother’s Electoral Card;


Documentation for registration of children of parents not yet baptized in the Catholic Church.

Important: All scanned documents must be based on their original version, officer will verify the originality of the documents.

  • A scanned of the father and mother’s Birth Certificate;
  • A scanned of the father and mother’s Identity Card;
  • A scanned of the Marriage Certificate, for the purpose of proving marital status;
  • A scanned of the father and mother’s Electoral Card;
  • A scanned of the Declaration of birth of the child issued by the Chief of Suco.
Related legislation:

Constitution of the Democratic Republic of Timor-Leste (2002). Civil Code of the Democratic Republic of Timor-Leste (2011).
service_footer_desc: Make sure you have read and understand the following provisions
desc_service_new_passport:
The Timor-Leste Electronic Passport (PETL) is an individual travel document, which allows its holders to enter and exit Timorese territory, as well as the territory of other States that recognize it for this purpose. The PETL can be issued in the following categories: a) ordinary passport; b) diplomatic passport; c) service passport; and d) passport for foreign citizens.

Who can request the service: Citizens are entitled to hold a common passport of Timorese nationality.

Responsible Institution: National Directorate of Records and Notary of the Ministry of Justice.

Deadline for issuing the Passport: The deadline for delivering the common passport is 10 working days, counting from the date of issuance of the receipt granting the concession request.

When the passport is requested at a consular service, the deadline is increased by two (02) business days for each delivery method.

Service provision channels:

National Territory:Service is provided in person at the units of the Registration and Notary Department of the Ministry of Justice, in Dili and in the Municipalities.

Abroad: At consular authorities designated by order of the member of the Government responsible for Foreign Affairs.

Opening Hours:

Price for access to the service:

Order TypeDelivery TimeFee
Normal10 business daysUSD 50
Express3 business daysUSD 75
Urgent1 business dayUSD 150


If the citizen requests the passport to be sent via postal service, the amount of USD 10 will be added.

A fee of USD 15 will be added to the passport required at the consular service.

Procedure required to access the service:

Request for Grant of Common Passport

The granting of a common passport is requested in person by the holder and the respective biographical data contained in the identity card is confirmed and the signature, personal data, facial image and fingerprints are obtained and collected.

To grant a common passport, it is mandatory to present the following documents:

1. Valid identity card (original and copy);
2. RDTL Birth Certificate (original and copy);
3. Proof of payment of the fee applicable to issuing the passport.

Notes: The PETL is valid for five (05) years.

Passport for children under 17

The application for granting a common passport must be presented by anyone who, under the terms of the law, exercises parental or guardianship authority, with the minor's attendance being mandatory. The following documents must be presented:

1. Valid identity card (original and copy);
2. RDTL Birth Certificate (original and copy);
3. Previous passport – if you already have it and are requesting renewal –, except in cases where it is lost, destroyed, stolen or misplaced; It is
4. Proof of payment of the fee applicable to issuing the passport.

In the case of married parents or those living in a similar situation, the minor must be accompanied by one of the parents who must present the following documents:

1. Valid identification document;
2. Copy of the marriage certificate or certificate or a joint statement under oath from both parents stating that they have lived in a situation similar to that of spouses for more than 2 years.

In the case of parents who are divorced, separated or who have never lived in a situation similar to that of spouses, the minor must be accompanied by a guardian who must present the following documents:

1. Valid identification document;
2. Document proving the exercise of parental responsibilities or guardianship issued less than 1 year ago.


Passport for interdicted or disabled people

The presence of the interdicted or disqualified person is mandatory, accompanied by their legal guardian, and provided with the following documents:

1. Valid identity card (original scan);
2. RDTL Birth Certificate (original scan);
3. Previous passport – if you already have it and are requesting renewal –, except in cases where it is lost, destroyed, stolen or misplaced;
4. Proof of payment of the fee applicable to issuing the passport;
5. Valid identification document of the guardian (original scan); It is

6. Document proving the exercise of guardianship or guardianship, issued less than 6 months ago (original scan).

Note: The signature of the minor, interdicted or disabled person will be collected whenever possible.

Related legislation:

Decree-Law No. 52/2016 of December 28th.

Ministerial Diploma No. 10/2017 of February 15th. Ministerial Diploma No. 10/2017 of February 15th.
desc_service_renew_passport:
Request for Renewing of Common Passport

The renewing of a common passport is requested in person by the holder and the respective biographical data contained in the identity card is confirmed and the signature, personal data, facial image and fingerprints are obtained and collected.

To grant a renewal common passport, it is mandatory to present the following documents:

1. Valid identity card (original and copy);
2. RDTL Birth Certificate (original and copy);
3. Previous passport
4. Proof of payment of the fee applicable to issuing the passport.

Notes: The PETL is valid for five (05) years.
desc_service_loss_passport:
Request of Common Passport When Loss

The renewing of a common passport is requested in person by the holder and the respective biographical data contained in the identity card is confirmed and the signature, personal data, facial image and fingerprints are obtained and collected.

To grant a renewal common passport, it is mandatory to present the following documents:

1. Valid identity card (original and copy);
2. RDTL Birth Certificate (original and copy);
3. A statement issued by the competent police authority.
4. Proof of payment of the fee applicable to issuing the passport.

In the case of a request to replace a passport due to loss, theft or misplacement, it is necessary to present a statement issued by the competent police authority.

Notes: The PETL is valid for five (05) years.
desc_service_damage_passport:
Request of Common Passport When Damage

The renewing of a common passport is requested in person by the holder and the respective biographical data contained in the identity card is confirmed and the signature, personal data, facial image and fingerprints are obtained and collected.

To grant a renewal common passport, it is mandatory to present the following documents:

1. Valid identity card (original and copy);
2. RDTL Birth Certificate (original and copy);
3. A statement issued by the competent police authority.
4. Proof of payment of the fee applicable to issuing the passport.

In the case of a request to replace a passport due to loss, theft or misplacement, it is necessary to present a statement issued by the competent police authority.

Notes: The PETL is valid for five (05) years.
question_1: What is the usual processing time for government applications?
question_2: Which documents are mandatory for a government applicant?
question_3: How can applicants track the status of their submissions?
question_4: Can the application submission be refused?
question_5: If I have questions, who can I speak to?
answer_1: The normal processing time for your applications will not exceed a week, however it depends on the type of services you applied for. Your application will be followed up by an officer and any feedback will be provided to you to accordingly for the successful of your application processing.
answer_2: Any legal documents issued by a government entity will be mandatory for an applicant, for example: Citizen Card, Birth Certificate, Village’s Declaration, Police Declaration, Election Card, etc. However, the documents required will be based on the type of services you selected.
answer_3: Applicant can track the status of their submission by login into the system and check their submission or request status.
answer_4:
Yes, the application submission can be refused:

  • If your supporting documents are incomplete.
  • If you never follow up confirmation from the officer.
  • if there are technical problems that make it impossible to complete the order.

In these cases, you will be informed by email about the recommendations and the next steps to take this to ensure that your next request can be successfully considered.
answer_5: Please send an email to portalmunicipal.mae@gmail.com or contact (+670) 333 9077 between 8am and 5pm, Monday to Friday except public holidays or declared point of tolerance day.
Please_leave_any_questions_you_have_here: Please leave any questions you have here

service_desc_desc_1: Explore our Applicant Service for Citizen Id! Streamlining the application process, it ensures hassle-free access to essential services. From simplified documentation to efficient processing, we’re here to make managing your family’s needs easier. Apply today for a smoother administrative experience!
service_desc_title_2: What you need prepare for this?
service_desc_desc_2:
• Scan of original valid CNIC/ NICOP/ Smart card.
  • Scan of the data page, two random pages asked by the system and the last ten passport pages of the original exhausted passport. Finger Prints Performa.
  • Original scan of a color picture with white background having specification 350/467 Pixels in JPEG/JPG format and not more than 3MB size.
  • The applicant has to submit a statement/declaration as per the prescribed format. (can be downloaded through the download tab after login to your account) that he/ she holds the original exhausted passport at the time of application and his passport pages have been exhausted due to frequent travel.
